about.short: CS student at USC Viterbi with expertise in AI/ML systems, RAG architectures, and generative AI applications. Dean's List Fall '24 & Spring '25.
paragraphs: I'm a Computer Science student at USC's Viterbi School of Engineering, passionate about building intelligent systems and applying data-driven approaches to challenging problems.

My work spans AI-powered code generation systems, full-stack web applications, and sports analytics. I've built production RAG pipelines, organized hackathons, and created software used by thousands of engineering students.
Currently seeking opportunities where I can apply my technical skills to impactful problems in software engineering or sports analytics.

bullets: Developed inventory management software now used by 2,700+ Viterbi engineering students
Manage 3D printing operations and equipment maintenance
Provide technical support and training for students on fabrication tools
Built AI-powered code generation system using RAG architecture with ChromaDB vector databases
Developed ingestion pipeline for API documentation and PDF processing
Implemented Docker-based code execution environment with composition viability checking
Created ~6,000 lines of production Python code supporting OpenAI and Ollama models
Founded and organized annual hackathon attracting 150+ participants
Secured $5,000+ in sponsorships from tech companies
Managed team of 15 volunteers and coordinated with school administration
Grew event from inception to recognized annual institution
Pursuing B.S. Computer Science with Minor in Mathematical Data Analytics
Dean's List recipient for academic excellence
Active in engineering community and maker space

projects.name: RAG Code Generator
projects.shortDesc: AI-powered code generation with vector search
projects.description: Production-grade code generation system using retrieval-augmented generation. Features ChromaDB vector databases with three specialized collections, an ingestion pipeline for API docs and PDFs, and composition viability checking before execution.

projects.name: Trashure Cove
projects.description: Hackathon-winning gamified platform that educates users about recycling through interactive challenges and rewards. Built in 24 hours at a competitive hackathon.

projects.name: QGo
projects.description: Winner at TOI WorldCodingBee. A grocery and local item delivery platform enabling users to order from local stores in India with doorstep delivery.

certifications: Back End Development and APIs – freeCodeCamp
JavaScript Algorithms and Data Structures – freeCodeCamp
